title: (Optional) Enable UCMDB Multi-Tenancy
content:
If you aren't using and don't plan to use the Service Management data domain segmentation feature, skip the steps in this topic. Please be aware that if you choose to use Native SACM without UCMDB multi-tenancy enabled, once Native SACM is enabled, you won't be able to use the data domain segmentation feature in Service Management.

If Service Management data domain segmentation is already in use (you have data domains set up besides the Public domain), you must enable multi-tenancy in UCMDB in order for Native SACM. In this scenario, Native SACM won't work anymore without enabling multi-tenancy in UCMDB. By enabling multi-tenancy in UCMDB, Service Management, and UCMDB are configured to support the data domain segmentation feature. For more information about Data Domain segmentation for Native SACM, see Adopt data domain segmentation for Native SACM.

If you have already enabled UCMDB multi-tenancy in UCMDB and you want to change the default tenant to All Tenants for your existing UCMDB customers, see Change default tenant for an existing UCMDB customer.

To enable UCMDB multi-tenancy, follow these steps:

  1. Follow these steps to disable CI owner tenant so that owner tenant and consumers tenants won't mix up.
    1. Open the UCMDB Server JMX Console of the Provider Customer, search for setGlobalSettingValue.

    2. Enter multi.tenancy.ci.ownerTenant.disabled for name and set value to true.

    3. Click Invoke.
  2. Follow these steps to enable UCMDB multi-tenancy. 
    1. Open the UCMDB Server JMX Console of the Provider Customer, and search for enableTenant.
    2. In the enableTenant section, set tenantName to All Tenants. This is the name of the default UCMDB tenant of the Provider customer and all the Consumers customers that you create later on (if UCMDB multi-customer is enabled).
      The existing Consumer customers will fall back to the "System Default Tenant" name. (This is a limitation that's being addressed). If you want to change the default tenant to All Tenants for the existing UCMDB customers, see Change default tenant for an existing UCMDB customer.
    3. Click Invoke.

      A message displays indicating that enabling tenant management mode is working in the backend, and will take a few minutes if there are already CIs exist in the database. After multi-tenancy is enabled, each existing CI’s owner-tenant and consumer-tenant will be associated with the default tenant specified by the tenantName parameter.

      You can view the tenant mode enablement status by invoking the viewTenantEnableStatus JMX method. 

    4. Restart the UCMDB server (pod). See Restart the ucmdb service.

    5. After the UCMDB default tenant is created, the multi-tenancy mode is enabled and all available UCMDB customers will have the default tenant created. 

For more information about UCMDB tenants, see Tenants Management (Classic UD/UCMDB) or Tenants Management (Containerized UD/UCMDB).
